oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pictorial history, Twenty-Seventh Division, United States Army, 1940-1941
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Yearbook of the 27th Division, New York's National Guard Division produced after they were federalized and training at Fort McClellan, Alabama. The book is 403 pages long. Most of the book is comprised of group photographs. Men are identified by first initial and last name.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States. Army. Infantry Division, 27th
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: World War, 1939-1945

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: William S. Bullock
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Formal portrait of soldier who served in a New York state military unit during the Civil War. Photograph shows soldier seated at table with a book wearing either a uniform or civilian clothing. Numbers on the front of some photographs refer to an index no longer extant. At one point, most of these photographs were tacked to the wall of the State Capital building in Albany, New York.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Formal portrait of soldier who served in a New York state military unit during the Civil War. Photograph shows soldier (face, upper body, seated, or standing) wearing either a uniform or civilian clothing. Numbers on the front of some photographs refer to an index no longer extant. At one point, most of these photographs were tacked to the wall of the State Capital building in Albany, New York.
